title: Insurance Terminology
description: Navigate the world of insurance with this quiz on policy terms, coverage types, and industry jargon.

questions.question: What is a 'deductible' in insurance?
options: A discount on your premium
The maximum amount an insurer will pay
A tax write-off for having insurance
The amount you must pay out of pocket before insurance coverage kicks in

questions.question: What does 'premium' mean in insurance?
options: The best type of coverage
The total value of a claim
The regular payment made to keep an insurance policy active
A bonus from your insurance company

questions.question: What is an 'actuary'?
options: An insurance salesperson
An insurance company executive
A professional who uses mathematics and statistics to assess risk and set premiums
A claims adjuster

questions.question: What does 'indemnity' mean in insurance?
options: A type of life insurance
A penalty for filing too many claims
An insurance policy for businesses
Compensation for loss or damage, restoring the insured to their pre-loss financial position

questions.question: What is a 'rider' on an insurance policy?
options: The person who delivers the policy
An amendment or addition that modifies the terms of the base policy
The primary policyholder
A motorcycle insurance requirement

questions.question: What does 'liability' coverage protect against?
options: Natural disasters
Damage to your own property
Claims made against you for causing injury or damage to others
Theft of your belongings

questions.question: What is 'subrogation' in insurance?
options: The insurer's right to pursue a third party that caused a loss to recover the amount paid on a claim
Transferring a policy to another person
Submitting a claim
Canceling a policy

questions.question: What does 'co-pay' mean in health insurance?
options: Splitting an insurance policy with a friend
The employer's share of insurance costs
A copyrighted insurance plan
A fixed amount you pay for a covered healthcare service at the time of service

questions.question: What is an 'exclusion' in an insurance policy?
options: Being denied insurance entirely
A premium discount for good behavior
A waiting period before coverage begins
A specific condition or circumstance not covered by the policy

questions.question: What does 'underwriter' mean in insurance?
options: The author of insurance regulations
A claims processor
Someone who writes policy documents
A person who evaluates risk and decides whether to accept or reject insurance applications

questions.question: What is a 'beneficiary'?
options: The person designated to receive the proceeds of an insurance policy
The company providing insurance
The insurance agent
A witness to the policy signing

questions.question: What does 'aggregate limit' mean?
options: The minimum claim amount
The maximum total amount an insurer will pay for all claims during a policy period
The monthly premium cap
The deductible amount

questions.question: What is 'comprehensive coverage' in auto insurance?
options: Coverage for non-collision damage such as theft, vandalism, weather, and animal strikes
Coverage for all drivers in a household
Coverage only for collisions
The most basic liability coverage

questions.question: What does 'grace period' mean in insurance?
options: The time to shop for a new policy
A waiting period before claims can be filed
A period of free insurance
Extra time after a premium due date during which the policy remains in effect

questions.question: What is a 'claim' in insurance?
options: A statement that you own a policy
A lawsuit against an insurer
A formal request to an insurance company for payment based on the terms of the policy
A quote for a new policy
